In compliance with the order, conveyed by your circular N. 9415,
Circular not found. I have the honor to suggest, that in the original estimate of expenditure for this establishment, anticipated as requisite for 1862 and as submitted by me to the late Government on the 19. Aug., a reduction may be effected by omitting the item "towards the enlargement of the collections at the botanical museum" £1600, soliciting at the same time, that the grant of this particular item, which I recommended for the permanent scientific consolidation of my establishment may at a future year be favorably entertained.

Should the Government be pleased to adopt under such reductions my former estimate, it will then be observed, that the schedules of estimate as printed by order of the late Government would need, as far as the amount for the botanical Gardens is concerned, an addition of £100 to the Salary of the Assistant and an addition of £100 to the Salary of the Curator, whilst a deduction of £200 could be effected for providing a Keeper of the zoological collections and a further deduction of £600 out of the wages fund, a sum of £4600 being provided in the printed schedule as in the previous year, instead of £4000, as regarded necessary during 1862.

I beg leave to suggest, that these £200 and £600 may be transferred to the estimate for the Acclimatisation establishment, for which the Council transmitted a special statement of its financial requirements during the coming year, exceeding considerably the sum placed for acclimatisation purposes by the late Government with estimates.
